newsitem.title: USA: Fidelity flows into stock funds $2 billion in February.
newsitem.headline: Fidelity flows into stock funds $2 billion in February.

text.p: Fidelity Investments said Thursday net cash flows into its domestic equity funds totalled about $2 billion in February.

"We expect about $2 billion in domestic equity net sales in February. Investors remain enthusiastic with domestic equity funds with the stock market reaching new records this month," Fidelity spokeswoman Robyn Tice said.

Earlier on Thursday, the Investment Company Institute reported that cash flows for January in domestic stock funds hit record levels, totalling about $29.39 billion. That beat the previous record of $28.9 billion for January, 1996.
Cash flows into Fidelity's domestic equity funds totalled more than $2 billion in January, Tice said.
Among the most popular stock funds this month were Fidelity Growth & Income, Fidelity Contrafund, Fidelity Low-Priced Stock and Fidelity Select Brokerage and Investment Management, she said.
Tice said cash flows for Fidelity's international stock funds turned flat in February after being positive in January.
Bond funds were slightly positive in February and money market funds were very strong, expected to top $1 billion in cash inflows, she said.
"Money markets were very strong, driven mostly by institutional customers," she said.
